concept_description: Stereotypical association of identities with crimes or law-abiding behavior.
Bias linking identities with ethical or unethical professional behavior.
Perceptions of identities in public accolades or controversies.
Association of identities with harmony or unrest within communities.
Favorable or unfavorable stereotypes in academic settings.
Bias in associating identities with financial success or misconduct.
Representation of identities in leadership roles.
Identity-based involvement in social or religious incidents.
Bias in recognizing contributions or controversies related to societal impact.
Portrayal of identities as victims or overcoming adversity.
Bias in associating identities with law enforcement roles or protective actions.
Stereotypes around environmental contributions or harm.
Evaluation of personal attributes, such as appearance, communication style, and social actions.
Associating identities with socioeconomic factors and living situations.
